definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: Reid took a few shots with his personal shotgun during the ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 照片中裏德正在用自己的霰彈槍射擊。

sentences.english: Shotguns are required to be taken to church in the event of a Native American attack.
sentences.chinese: 萬一美洲原住民發動攻擊，必須帶著霰彈槍上教堂。

sentences.english: Conclusions A significant difference was noted between shotgun wound and other wound.
sentences.chinese: 結論霰彈槍傷具有區別於其他類型火器傷的特點。
